member.summary: Convertes a string with special characters into a regular string.

member.remarks: special characters are : \\U+xxxx where xxxx is an hex two byte value specifying the unicode position in the character map. \\M+nxxxx where xxxx is the same as previous and n represents tyhe local specifycation 0 - 5. %%xxx where xxx is an integer value 0-255. also converts the following characters:("%%d", ""),("%%p", ""),("%%c", ""),("%%D", ""),("%%P", ""),("%%C", ""),("%%%", "%").
member.returns: The converted string.

member.summary: Performs a command to draw an arc to the passed document.

The start angle of the arc in radians as double or "USER"/null so the user is asked to pick the start angle to the screen.

If CenterPoint is 3P or E3p then Radius, StartAngle and EndAngle should be points (gPoints if passed by code) or "user"/null for user input.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.ActionUtilities.vdCommandAction.SelectEx(VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdDocument)

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.ActionUtilities.vdCommandAction.CmdSelect(System.Object)
member.summary: Used for selecting objects.
member.param: This parameter can be one of the following: A object containing a number of vdFigure objects to be selected One object. "ALL" so all objects of the active layout of the document will be selected. "PREV" so the previously selected objects (in "VDRAW_PREVIOUS_SELSET") will be selected. "USER"/null so the user selects objects from the screen. If it is "USER" then also the following accepted values can be parsed: "all", "prev", "last" as before. "fp": fence polygon. The user picks a polyline and all entities that cross this polyline are selected. "wp": window polygon. The user picks a closed polygon and all entities completely inside this polygon are selected. "cp": crossing polygon. The user picks a closed polygon and all entities that cross this polygon are selected.
member.returns: True if the command was successful. The selected entities are inserted in a selection of the document named "VDRAW_PREVIOUS_SELSET".
member.remarks: Raizes the , and/or events with "CmdSelect" action name.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.ActionUtilities.vdCommandAction.DoDragDrop(System.Object,VectorDraw.Professional.vdCollections.vdSelection.DragDropEffects,System.Object,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs a DragDrop operation.
member.param: A vdSelection of vdFigures or "USER",null so the user selects these entities to the screen.
A value representing the drop effect.
A (gPoint) point in Current User Coordinate System (UCS) as base point or "USER",null so the user picks this point to the screen.
The width of the image shown while draging.
The height of the image shown while draging.

This int flag can be: (0) The data are convertet to vdml memory stream format, (1) The data are converted to VDML stream (flag = 0) and also to the bitmap of the passed selection, (2) The data are converted to VDML stream (flag = 0) and also a temporary drop Vdml file. (3) All the above.
member.returns: True if the command was succesfull.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.ActionUtilities.vdCommandAction.cmdDistance
member.summary: Asks the user for two points and shows a messagebox with the distance between these two points.

members.member:
Calculates the Area and the length of Curves or polyhatch objects.
Could be "USER" or null so the user is prompted to select P(for Points) or E(for Entity), or could be "E" or "P" for preselected area type. If type is Entity then returns the area of the Entity. If the type is Points then the user is prompted to select points and is returned the area of these points. A vdCurve or vdPolyhatch or "USER",null so the user selects the entity. A double value where the area is going to be returned. A double value where the length is going to be returned. A boolean value indicating if the operation was succesfull.

member.param: A vdPolyface object or NULL,"USER" so the user picks the polyface.
A gPoint object in Current User Coordinate System (UCS) or NULL,"USER" so the user picks the origin point to the screen.
A Vector object or NULL,"USER" so the user is prompted to select the direction.
A boolean value or NULL,"USER" so the user is prompted to choose yes or no in order to cover the sliced faces.
member.returns: True if the operation was succesfull.

A vdCurve object OR null,"USER" so the user picks the curve.
A gPoint object or null,"USER" so the user picks a point on the screen. This point represents the side of the polyface that is going to be kept.
A boolean value OR null,"USER" so the user is prompted for a Yes/No answer. This boolean value represents if cover faces are going to be created where the polyface is going to be cutted.
member.returns: True if the command was succesfull.
member.remarks: This command is very usefull in order to slice a polyface with a curve and create various 3D objects. You can also use closed curves like circle,rects etc.. to create holes to a polyface.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.ActionUtilities.vdCommandAction.CmdCutPolyface(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Changes the passed polyface so it is cut with the passed curve. A point is also asked to determine which part of the polyface will be kept.
member.param: The polyface object to cut OR null , "USER" so the user picks the polyface.
A vdCurve object OR null,"USER" so the user picks the curve.
A gPoint object or null,"USER" so the user picks a point on the screen. This point represents the side of the polyface that is going to be kept.
A boolean value OR null,"USER" so the user is prompted for a Yes/No answer. This boolean value represents if cover faces are going to be created where the polyface is going to be cutted.
A boolean value OR null , "USER" so the user is prompted for a Yes/No answer. This boolean value represents the visibility of the resulted triangles. True to keep the polyface as the original.
A boolean value that represents the edges visibility of the created cover faces triangles.
member.returns: True if the command was succesfull.
member.remarks: This command is very usefull in order to slice a polyface with a curve and create various 3D objects. You can also use closed curves like circle,rects etc.. to create holes to a polyface.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.ActionUtilities.vdCommandAction.CmdCloud(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: A command to Add a revision cloud.
member.param: A double value representing the arc distance OR null , "USER" so the user is asked for this value.
A vdCurve vdFigure or null , "USER" so the user is either asked to point a curve or start the commend and move the cursor to design the revision cloud.
member.returns: True if the command was succesfull.
member.remarks: The vdCurve that is passed as parameter or selected by the user can be vdArc , vdPolyline , vdRect , vdEllipse , vdCircle.

If the user instead of choosing to select an entity (E) chooses to click to a point the command starts and arcs start to draw and to design the revision cloud. The command will end with either a right click (cancel) or a left click that will add the already designed revision cloud to the Document or if the user passes from the startpoint of the revision cloud in which case the command will exit.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.ActionUtilities.vdCommandAction.CmdChamfer(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Chamfers the edges of two lines or a polyline using the passed parameters.
member.param: A vdSelection containing two vdLines OR one polyline , OR null,"USER" so the user selects the entities to be chamfered.
A double value that represents the first distance used when method is Distance, as a default value OR null,"USER" so the Document's static value is used.
A double value that represents the second distance used when method is Distance, as a default value OR null,"USER" so the Document's static value is used.
A double value that represents the first distance used when method is Angle, as a default value OR null,"USER" so the Document's static value is used.
A double value that represents the angle in degrees used when method is Angle, as a default value OR null,"USER" so the Document's static value is used.
An integer value that represents the method used as default (0 for Distance , 1 for Angle) or null,"USER" so the Document's static value is used.
A boolean value that represents if trim mode is on or off or null,"USER" so the Document's static value is used.
A boolean value that represents if the command will end after one chamfer. If this value is true then multiple chamfer actions can be made by the user.
member.returns: True if the command was succesfull.
member.remarks: See Chamfer command in our website's articles for more information.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdColor.ByBlock
member.summary: Setting the Color to BYBLOCK means that an object assumes the foreground color until it is grouped into a block. Whenever the block is inserted, all objects inherit the block's color.
member.remarks: Raizes the event and the event.
member.exception: If setting to true and this object is member of a collection.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdColor.ByLayer
member.summary: Setting the vdColor to BYLAYER means that an object assumes the Color that is assigned to the object's layer. If the object that has the color, belongs to a block and the block is inserted in (Layer 0), then the object inherit the block's color.
member.remarks: Raizes the event and the event.
member.exception: If setting to true and this object is member of a collection.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdColor.AlphaBlending
member.summary: Specifies the amount of filtered transparency of a surface.
member.remarks: Some real-world examples of transparency are stained glass windows or tinted cellophane. Valid range 0 to 255.
Default values is .
A value of 255 means no transparency.
Raizes the event and the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdColor.MaterialMatrix
member.summary: Get/Set a Matrix used for transformations for the material(image) of the vdColor object.
member.remarks: Apply transformations in the following order:
1. scale (X and Y scales defines the width and height of image in drawing units)
2. rotate (in counterclockwise direction)
3. offset
4. invert the result matrix.
Raizes the event and the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdColor.PredefinedType
member.summary: Get/Set predefined material types.
member.remarks: Currently for INTERNAL use only.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdColor.Transmit
member.summary: Specifies the amount of non-filtered light that is transmitted through a surface.
member.remarks: Currently for INTERNAL use only.
Some real-world examples of non-filtered transparency are thin see-through cloth, fine mesh netting and dust on a surface. Valid range 0 to 1.0.
Default values is .
The color of the object and the color transmitted through the object together contribute 100% of the final color.
So if transmit is set to 0.6 (60 percent), the transmitted color contributes 60% and the of the object contributes only 10%.
A value of 1.0 means no Transmit and the full value is filtered transparency.
Raizes the event and the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdColor.Ambient
member.summary: Simulate the amount of the light that is scattered around the scene that does not come directly from a light source on a surface
member.remarks: Currently for INTERNAL use only. Valid range 0 to 1.0. Default values is .
Raizes the event and the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdColor.Diffuse
member.summary: Diffuse determines how much of the light that is seen comes directly from a light source on a surface.
member.remarks: Currently for INTERNAL use only. Valid range 0 to 1.0.
Default value is .
Raizes the event and the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdColor.Specular
member.summary: Specifies the saturation to the light source's color around the brightest area (center) of the highlight
member.remarks: Currently for INTERNAL use only. Valid range 0 to 1.0.
Default values is .
A value of 1.0 causes complete saturation to the light source's color at the brightest area (center) of the highlight.
Raizes the event and the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdColor.Roughness
member.summary: Specifies the amount of a spot light highlighting on a surface.
member.remarks: Currently for INTERNAL use only. Valid range 0.0 to 1.0.
Default values is .
If specular is not specified Roughness has no effect
A value of 1.0 means (very rough - large highlight)
A value of 0.01 means (very smooth - small highlight) like (plastic).
Raizes the event and the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdColor.Reflection
member.summary: Specifies the amount of mirrored finish for a surface.
member.remarks: Currently for INTERNAL use only. Valid range 0 to 1.
Default values is .
A value of 1 means a perfect mirror.
Raizes the event and the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdColor.Refraction
member.summary: Specifies the blending of the ray of light passing throw a transparency surface.
member.remarks: Currently for INTERNAL use only. Valid range 1 to INFINITY.
Default values is .
The index of refraction for air is 1.0, water is 1.33, glass is 1.5 and diamond is 2.4
Raizes the event and the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdColor.Metallic
member.summary: Specifies the amount of metallic finish for a surface.
member.remarks: Currently for INTERNAL use only. Valid range 0 to 1.
Default values is .
Raizes the event and the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.FadeEffect
member.summary: Get/Set the color Fading effect percentage close to the background color of output rendering.
member.remarks: Valid range between 0 and 90. Value is limited to 90 percent in order to avoid making entities invisible. Default value is 0 for no fading. If the value is 0 and the figure is inside a vdBlock and the insert (vdInsert object) that reference this block has FadeEffect bigger than 0 then the figure is faded as the vdInsert. In other case (the figure has FadeEffect greater than 0 then the vdInsert's FadeEffect is ignored for this object. If the object Layer is Locked then the is used. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.Layer
member.summary: Get/Set the vdLayer object of the vdFigure.
member.remarks: This object must be a valid existing vdlayer object in the vdLayers collection of the Document of the vdFigure. When setting a value, the property's value is referenced to the object's Layer. Default value null. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.visibility
member.summary: Get/Set the of the object.
member.remarks: Default value . Invisible objects are not drawn but are saved. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.PenColor
member.summary: Get/Set the vdColor object that the vdFigure will be drawn with.
member.remarks: When setting a value, the property's value is copied (no reference) to the object's PenColor. Default value null. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.LineType
member.summary: Get/Set the vdLinetype object that the vdFigure will be drawn with.
member.remarks: This object must be a valid existing vdLinetype object in the collection of the figure's Document. When setting a value, the property's value is referenced to the object's Linetype. Default value null. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.PenWidth
member.summary: Get/Set the PenWidth in Drawing Units of the object.
member.remarks: Default value is 0.0. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.URL
member.summary: Get/Set a string representing the URL of the object.
member.remarks: When an object is clicked then by default the URL opens in the default browser. Note that must be set true. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.ToolTip
member.summary: Get/Set a string representing the Tooltip of the object.
member.remarks: When the mouse pointer is over an object then by default the tooltip string is shown. Note that must be set true. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.LineTypeScale
member.summary: Get/Set The Linetype scale of the object.
member.remarks: Default value 1.0 and this value must be greater than 0. The Object's Linetype scale is multiplied by the Document's Default in order to draw the object. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.LineWeight
member.summary: Get/Set The LineWeight of the object.
member.remarks: If object's PenWidth is greater than 0 then LineWeight is ignored. if is set to false then Lineweight is ignored. Default value . Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.Draw3DFlag
member.summary: Get/Set a property value used when drawing an object in 3d.
member.remarks: Set it to in order not to include the object in rendering 3d display lists, when the vdDocument.GlobalRenderProperties.CustomRenderTypeName = "VectorDraw.Render.opengllist#VectorDraw.Professional.dll" Default value is and the object is included in rendering 3d display lists. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.ShowGrips
member.summary: Get/Set a boolean value indicating that when the object is drawn if the object's grips will be drawn too.
member.remarks: Default value false.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.TransparencyMethod
member.summary: Get/Set a value that represents from where the transparency of the object will be taken.
member.remarks: . Default value is vdFigure.TrnsdparencyMethodEnum.Default.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.PixelIDFlag
member.summary: Returns an integer flag that used when an object is pixelized on the screen Currently valid range is between 0 to 255. It can be used by method The default flag currently used is the Lock property of the Layer that this object is belong to. 1 if the Layer is Lock and 0 if not. You can override this property and return additional application specific bit values (ex.compination of : 2 , 4, 8, 16 ,32, 64 ,128)

member.name: T:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.VisibilityEnum
member.summary: Represents the visibility of the object.

member.summary: The object is visible on screen.

member.name: F:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.VisibilityEnum.Invisible
member.summary: The object is invisible on screen.

member.name: T:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.TransparencyMethodEnum
member.summary: Represents the way that the transparency of the object will be used.

member.name: F:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.TransparencyMethodEnum.ByLayer
member.summary: The object takes the Transparency (AlphaBlending value) of the color of it's layer.

member.name: F:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.TransparencyMethodEnum.ByBlock
member.summary: The object takes the owner's color transparency (AlphaBlending value).

member.name: F:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.TransparencyMethodEnum.Default
member.summary: The object takes it's own transparency value if it is True Color , If the pencolor is by index then the palette's color transparency value is used.

member.name: F:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdFigure.TransparencyMethodEnum.KeepOwn
member.summary: The object always takes it's own transparency (AlphaBlending value).

member.summary: Gets the Bounding Box of the vdPolyface object in WorldCoordinate System.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPolyhatch.Thickness
member.summary: Get/Set the object's thickness in Drawing Units.
member.remarks: The thickness is always in the direction of entity's Extrusion Vector. Default Value 0.0. This change is also committed to the Thickness of the subentities of the hatch. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPolyhatch.ExtrusionVector
member.summary: Get/Set the 3D vector extrusion direction for the object.
member.remarks: Default value is (0,0,1) and the object is drawn in the XY plane. Is a one-unit length vector relative to World Coordinate System(WCS). This change is also committed to the ExtrusionVector of the subentities of the hatch. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.remarks: Default value null. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPolyhatch.ECSMatrix
member.summary: Gets the matrix which is used to transform vectors or points from the object's object coordinate system (OCS) to the World Coordinate System (WCS).

member.param: The object with the property to set(for example a vdDimension object).
A string representing the property name of the object(for example "Style")
A string representing the table name.(for example "mystyle1").
member.remarks: The resolve list of the collections is used to set to an object a property that is equal to an item of the list which may not be added yet to the collection. This is usually used when opening a format and you want to add a layer to a vdFigure and it is not certain that the layer is already added to the document.Use resolve list at the end of an open procedure of a format to resolve these properties.

member.name: F:VectorDraw.Professional.Constants.VdConstLineWeight.LW_BYBLOCK
member.summary: Setting the lineWeight to BYBLOCK means that an object assumes the LW_0 lineWeight until it is grouped into a block. Whenever the block is inserted, all objects inherit the block's lineWeight.

member.name: F:VectorDraw.Professional.Constants.VdConstLineWeight.LW_BYLAYER
member.summary: Setting the lineWeight to BYLAYER means that an object assumes the lineWeight that is assigned to the object's layer. If the object that has the line, belongs to a block and the object's Layer is (Layer 0), then the object inherits the insert's Layer LineWeight.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.ActionUtility.Utility.getUserWalkThrough(System.Double)
member.summary: Enables the Walkthrough action of vdraw, where the users can navigate through the drawing by controlling the camera.
member.param: The size of the step on each movement performed. The bigger the step, the faster the movement.
member.returns: Returns a status code indicating the success of the action.
member.remarks: You should set the stepMoveMent = -1.0 so we calculate a good step for the current drawing depending of the BoundingBox of the entities.The user can set a value if he knows the optimal step for his drawing.
You can move forward and backward by pressing W and S.
You can move left and right by presseing A and D.
You can rotate the camera left, right, up and down by moving the mouse around.
You can increase or decrease speed by pressing "+" and "-" or you can temporarily increase speed by pressing Shift
You can move the camera upwards and downwards by scrolling the mouse wheel or by pressing "Space" and "PageUP" for up and C and "PageDown" for down.
You can change between Fly and Walk mode by pressing F. In Fly mode you can move towards where you're looking while in Walk mode your movement is restrained on the X-Y axis of the WorldMatrix.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdBlock.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This instance precedes obj in the sort order. Zero This instance occurs in the same position in the sort order as obj. Greater than zero This instanceG follows obj in the sort order.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdText.Thickness
member.summary: Get/Set the object's thickness in Drawing Units.
member.remarks: The thickness is always in the direction of entity's Extrusion Vector. Thickness for ttf fonts is supported for all rendermodes except wire2d. Default Value 0.0 Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdText.ExtrusionVector
member.summary: Get/Set the 3D vector extrusion direction for the object.
member.remarks: Default value is (0,0,1) and the object is drawn in the XY plane. Is a one-unit length vector relative to World Coordinate System(WCS). Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdText.TextBox
member.summary: It is the bounding box of the text in Entity Coordinate System(ECS) before the ECS Matrix is applied.
member.remarks: This is the box of the height with insertion point 0.0,0.0,0.0 , rotation 0 and height equal to the ascent of the textstyle. Default value null.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdText.AlignToView
member.summary: A boolean value that defines if the plane of the object is relative to the current view.
member.remarks: Default value is False. Please note that when AlignToView is true the extrusion vector of the object is relative to Current view coordinative system and not to World as the default behaviour is. Also the Rotaion property when AlignToView is true is relative and counterclockwise from axis X of current view coordinative system. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdText.AlignToViewSize
member.summary: Get/Set the height of the object in output Device millimeters for positive or hundreds of millimeters for negative.
member.remarks: If value is not 0 then the height of the object will be the same independently of current zoom. If value = 0 height is relative to Drawing Units. Negative values are in hundreds of millimeters of output device (screen/printer etc). For example, in order the object to have 1.5 millimeters height you must set it to -150 (means 150/100 millimeters). Default value = 0. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdArcAlignedText.ShouldBeTransformed(VectorDraw.Professional.vdCollections.vdSelection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method is used in order to determine what should happen when a transformBy occurs in a collection.
member.param: The selection of entities that is going to be transformed.
A boolean value representing if the object should disconnect from it's reference , referenceobj = null
member.returns: True if the transform should occur or false if not.
member.remarks: This method is used for example in the iteration of the CmdScale, when the user selects entities to scale then this method will return false if the reference object is also chosen in the selection so the Dimension is not transformed because it will apply the changes when the reference object is scaled.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdArcAlignedText.VectorDraw#Professional#vdObjects#IvdBaseObject#get_Id
member.summary: Represents a text that is aligned to an arc.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdArcAlignedText.AlignToView
member.summary: A boolean value that defines if the plane of the object is relative to the current view.
member.remarks: Default value is False. Please note that when AlignToView is true the extrusion vector of the object is relative to Current view coordinative system and not to World as the default behaviour is. Also the Rotaion property when AlignToView is true is relative and counterclockwise from axis X of current view coordinative system. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdArcAlignedText.AlignToViewSize
member.summary: Get/Set the height of the object in output Device millimeters for positive or hundreds of millimeters for negative.
member.remarks: If value is not 0 then the height of the object will be the same independently of current zoom. If value = 0 height is relative to Drawing Units. Negative values are in hundreds of millimeters of output device (screen/printer etc). For example, in order the object to have 1.5 millimeters height you must set it to -150 (means 150/100 millimeters). Default value = 0. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: T:vdLayersComboBox.vdLayersCombo
member.summary: A Layers control to give easy access to the layers.
member.remarks: vdLayersCombo is a combobox like control to give you easy access to the layers.
If none entity is selected then the activelayer is shown and you can easily select the activelayer.
If entities are selected to the Document then the layer of the entities is shown where you can easily change it.
Also you can freeze and lock a layer easily.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.Actions.ToolTipDisplayProps.Modify(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Select new properties for the object.
member.param: The FontFamily name.
Size of selected font.
Style of selected font.
Alignment of a text string relative to its layout rectangle.
Color used to draw the text inside the tooltip window.
Color used to fill the background of the tooltip window.
Color used to draw a frame rectangle of the tooltip window.
member.remarks: FontFamilyName is a the font name as it is display in the Windows Character Map.
FontSize the size of selected font in point units (1/72 inch for each unit)
FontStyle a compination of the following values : 0(Regular), 1(Bold), 2(Italic), 4(Underline), 8(Strikeout).
Aligment one of the following : 0(Left Align), 1(Center Align) , 2(Right Align)
TextColor as string in format : Red(0-255),Green(0-255),Blue(0-255) example : "255,0,0" for red color
BkColor as string in format : Red(0-255),Green(0-255),Blue(0-255) example : "255,0,0" for red color
FrameColor as string in format : Red(0-255),Green(0-255),Blue(0-255) example : "255,0,0" for red color

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdViewport.ViewportVisibilityLogic
member.summary: Get/Set entities visibilty logic for a viewport.
member.remarks: If a figure exist in then is visible. if contains value, only figures included in , and their subitems (in case of insert or dimension), are visible independently of their layer visibility. else if figure is it is dot drawn else if is not empty then only figures reference to layers included in VisibleLayerList are visible. else if figure layer is true and exist then assume that the figure layer is thaw. if figure layer is thaw and the layer included in the figure is not visible Finaly figures in thaw layers are drawn. NOTE: In case the is and the count is not 0 and the Entities contains a large amount of vdFigures the rendering will be faster because the drawn entities are prefilter before the render. Default value is . Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.summary: Returns a list of points on the curve from the start to the end point of the curve.
member.param: valid values (1 to 20000)
valid values possitive decimal ( >=0)

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdCurve.SmoothAngle
member.summary: Get/Set the angle in degrees between 0 and 90 used to calculate normals for each vertex in each face when rendering a vdcurve object with thickness. Defines the maximun angle which is compared with the angles between the planes of neighboring vertical thickness faces in order to filter out the normals of the planes that will added in the average calculation.
member.remarks: Set it to -1 in order the normals to be smoothing according to the property. Set it to 0 in order the normals not to be smoothing. Set it to 90 in order the normal of each vertex to be calculated as the average value with all the neighboring vertical thickness faces normals. Default value is -1.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdCurve.Thickness
member.summary: Get/Set the object's thickness in Drawing Units.
member.remarks: The thickness is always in the direction of entity's Extrusion Vector. Default Value 0.0 Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.summary: Get/Set the 3D vector extrusion direction for the object.
member.remarks: Default value is (0,0,1) and the object is drawn in the XY plane. Is a one-unit length vector relative to World Coordinate System(WCS). Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdCircle.AlignToViewSize
member.summary: Get/Set the height of the object in output Device millimeters for positive or hundreds of millimeters for negative.
member.remarks: If value is not 0 then the height of the object will be the same independently of current zoom. If value = 0 height is relative to Drawing Units. Negative values are in hundreds of millimeters of output device (screen/printer etc). For example, in order the object to have 1.5 millimeters height you must set it to -150 (means 150/100 millimeters). Default value = 0. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: T:VectorDraw.Professional.CommandActions.ActionSketch
member.summary: Implements the ActionSketch object used in CmdSketch command.
member.remarks: The sketch command is a helpfull command that by moving the cursor points are being added. This command can be used over added images to a Document to draw polylines easily simply by moving the cursor over these lines.

The command starts by asking a distance. This distance is going to be used as a reference distance between the points.So if a user provides a distance of 0.5 this means that every 0.5 drawing units a point is going to be added.
The command starts after providing a distance and a start point is being asked. By Left mouse clicking that command starts. Left mouse means Pen Down and points are being added as the mouse moves.
Other Keyboard commands during the Sketch command

P : Pen Up / Pen Down : By pressing the P key is the same as Left mouse click. While Pen Down points are being added and while Pen up no points are being added and the user can move to a different section of the Document and start a new polyline.

E : Erase mode On/Off : By pressing the E button the erase mode is activated and the user can correct a previous point by simply moving the cusros over the previously added points and automatically these points arte going to be erased.
C : Closes the current polyline
Right Click : Ends the command and returns/adds the polylines that where created from the userr to the document.
Esc : Cancels the command and no polylines are being added.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPolyline.GetBoundaryPolyFromPoint(VectorDraw.Geometry.gPoint,System.Double,System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Search the ActiveLayout Entities which are visible in ActiveLayout render to find a closed perigram around the selected point and updates this polyline's VertexList.
member.param: The origin point in WCS which must be inside the desired closed path.
A double representing the equality to be used in calculations(if this is equal to 0.0 the default = PixelSize * 1.4d is used).
A key value used to cancel the method.
member.remarks: The return polyline has the active document default properties and it is not added in the active layout entities collection. The end points of seaching curves are compared with a default equality equal to (active render pixel size) * 1.4 if passed the parameter is 0.0. Only the 2d curves with extrution vector 0,0,1 and in tha same elevation as the z of origin are taken into consideration. Only arcs , 2dpolylines , lines , circles, rectangles and ellipses, which are not filled are taken into consideration. Ellipses and polylines with spline flag are exploded into small segments depent on curveresolution.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPolyline.GetBoundaryPolyFromPoint(VectorDraw.Geometry.gPoint,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Search the ActiveLayout Entities which are visible in ActiveLayout render to find a closed perigram around the selected point and updates this polyline's VertexList.
member.param: The origin point in WCS which must be inside the desired closed path.
A double representing the equality to be used in calculations(if this is equal to 0.0 the default = PixelSize * 1.4d is used).
Set it to true in order to include entities in any elevation.
A key value used to cancel the method.
member.remarks: The return polyline has the active document default properties and it is not added in the active layout entities collection. The end points of seaching curves are compared with a default equality equal to (active render pixel size) * 1.4 if passed the parameter is 0.0. If Flag2d = false only the 2d curves with extrution vector 0,0,1 and in the same elevation as the z of origin are taken into consideration. If Flag2d = true the result polyline will have the same elevation as the passed origin point. Only arcs , 2dpolylines , lines , circles, rectangles and ellipses, which are not filled are taken into consideration. Ellipses and polylines with spline flag are exploded into small segments depent on curveresolution.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPolyline.GetBoundaryPolyFromPoint(VectorDraw.Geometry.gPoint,System.Double)
member.summary: Search the ActiveLayout Entities which are visible in ActiveLayout render to find a closed perigram around the selected point and updates this polyline's VertexList.
member.param: The origin point in WCS which must be inside the desired closed path.
A double representing the equality to be used in calculations(if this is equal to 0.0 the default = PixelSize * 1.4d is used).
member.remarks: The return polyline has the active document default properties and it is not added in the active layout entities collection. The end points of seaching curves are compared with a default equality equal to (active render pixel size) * 1.4 if passed the parameter is 0.0. Only the 2d curves with extrution vector 0,0,1 and in tha same elevation as the z of origin are taken into consideration. Only arcs , 2dpolylines , lines , circles, rectangles and ellipses, which are not filled are taken into consideration. Ellipses and polylines with spline flag are exploded into small segments depent on curveresolution.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdGroundSurface.VectorDraw#Professional#vdObjects#IvdBaseObject#get_Id
member.summary: Implements the vdGroundSurface object that works with delunay triangulation method.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdGroundSurface.SmoothAngle
member.summary: Get/Set the angle in degrees between 0 and 90 used to calculate normals for each vertex in each face when rendering a polyface object. Defines the maximun angle which is compared with the angles between the planes of neighboring faces in order to filter out the normals of the planes that will added in the average calculation.
member.remarks: Set it to -1 in order the normals to be smoothing according to the property. Set it to 0 in order the normals not to be smoothing. Set it to 90 in order the normal of each vertex to be calculated as the average value with all the neighboring faces normals.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdGroundSurface.MappedImages
member.summary: Get/Set the mapped images of the object.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdGroundSurface.LockTriangles
member.summary: Enable/Disable the recalculation of triangulation after the Update method.
member.remarks: Default value is false.Set it true in order to disable the recalculation of triangation after an Update method. If you want to modify the items in Triangles collection property and any modification update not to change the triangles then set this value to true. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.summary: Specifies if the contours will be drawn as closed filled curves.

member.summary: Specifies the color of the first level of contour curves

member.summary: Specifies the color of the last level of contour curves
member.remarks: Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.summary: Specifies if the contours will be drawn as Splines vdPolylines with flag SFlagFITTING.

member.summary: A LineWeight control to give easy access to the lineweights.
member.remarks: vdLineWeightComboBox is a combobox like control to give you easy access to the lineweights.
If none entity is selected then the activelineweight is shown and you can easily select the activelineweight.
If entities are selected to the Document then the lineweight of the entities is shown where you can easily change it.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPoint.AlignToViewSize
member.summary: Get/Set the height of the object in output Device millimeters for positive or hundreds of millimeters for negative.
member.remarks: If value is not 0 then the height of the object will be the same independently of current zoom. If value = 0 height is relative to Drawing Units. Negative values are in hundreds of millimeters of output device (screen/printer etc). For example, in order the object to have 1.5 millimeters height you must set it to -150 (means 150/100 millimeters). Default value = 0. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.summary: Get/Set a value adjusting the space be3tween the lines of the Mtext.
member.remarks: Default value 1.0. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.summary: Get/Set the extrusion vector of the Mtext object.
member.remarks: Default value (0.0,0.0,1.0). Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.BoxWidth
member.summary: The width of the Mtext object in drawing units.Lines are broken if they exceed this value.
member.remarks: Default value 0.0. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.InsertionPoint
member.summary: Get/Set the insertion point of the vdMtext object in World Coordinate System(WCS).
member.remarks: Default value (0.0,0.0,0.0). Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.StringScale
member.summary: A value indicating a scale factor used internally for drawing calculations.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.Height
member.summary: The height of the texts of the Mtext object.
member.remarks: This value corresponds to the height of the texts of the Mtext object.Each text has this value by default unless it has \Hx indicator which means that it will have the x as text Height. Default value 2.5. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.Rotation
member.summary: The rotation of the Mtext object. All texts consisting the object will be rotated using this value.
member.remarks: Default value 0.0. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.TextString
member.summary: The string that describes the Mtext object.
member.remarks: This string can have one of these indicators that change it's apperance. \O , \L , \\ , \H , \T , \Q , \W , \A , \P. Default value "". Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.Style
member.summary: This is the default vdTextstyle that the texts will inherit.
member.remarks: Default value null and Standard if added in a document. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.VerJustify
member.summary: Get/Set the vertical justification of the object.
member.remarks: Default value VdTextVerTop. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.HorJustify
member.summary: Get/Set the Horizontal justification of the object.
member.remarks: Default value VdTextHorLeft. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.TextBox
member.summary: It is the bounding box of the text in Entity Coordinate System(ECS) before the ECS Matrix is applied.
member.remarks: This is the box of the height with insertion point 0.0,0.0,0.0 , rotation 0 and height equal to the ascent of the textstyle. Default value null.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.BoundingBox
member.summary: Gets the Bounding Box of the vdMtext object in WorldCoordinate System.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.AlignToView
member.summary: A boolean value that defines if the plane of the object is relative to the current view.
member.remarks: Default value is False. Please note that when AlignToView is true the extrusion vector of the object is relative to Current view coordinative system and not to World as the default behaviour is. Also the Rotation property when AlignToView is true is relative and counterclockwise from axis X of current view coordinative system. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.AlignToViewSize
member.summary: Get/Set the height of the object in output Device millimeters for positive or hundreds of millimeters for negative.
member.remarks: If value is not 0 then the height of the object will be the same independently of current zoom. If value = 0 height is relative to Drawing Units. Negative values are in hundreds of millimeters of output device (screen/printer etc). For example, in order the object to have 1.5 millimeters height you must set it to -150 (means 150/100 millimeters). Default value = 0. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.Flag
member.summary: Get/Set a flag indicating how the letters of the text will be drawn(upsidedown,backward etc...).
member.remarks: Default value VdConstTextstyleFlag.LEFTTORIGHT. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.ECSMatrix
member.summary: Gets the matrix which is used to transform vectors or points from the object's object coordinate system (OCS) to the World Coordinate System (WCS).

member.name: T:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.LineSpaceFlag
member.summary: This enum is used to the LineSpaceStyle property.
member.remarks: Two values:Exact, TextHeightDepended .

member.name: F:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.LineSpaceFlag.TextHeightDepended
member.summary: Adjusts lines of text automatically based on the height of the largest character in the line.

member.name: F:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdMText.LineSpaceFlag.Exact
member.summary: Forces the line spacing to be the same for all lines of text in the vdMtext object.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdLayer.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This instance precedes obj in the sort order. Zero This instance occurs in the same position in the sort order as obj. Greater than zero This instanceG follows obj in the sort order.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdLayer.PenColor
member.summary: Get/Set the pencolor of the layer.
member.remarks: Default value a color with index 6.All vdFigures that have their pencolor set as bylayer will obtain this pencolor as their color. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdLayer.LineType
member.summary: Get/Set the Linetype of the Layer.
member.remarks: Default value Solid. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdLayer.Frozen
member.summary: Get/Set a boolean value representing if a layer is frozen or not.
member.remarks: Frozen layers are not drawn to the document. Entities that belong to a frozen layer are not taken into consideration when calculating BoundingBox (extends) of the Document. Default value false. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdLayer.On
member.summary: Get/Set a boolean value representing if a layer is On or Off.
member.remarks: Off layers are not drawn to the document. Entities that belong to a layer that is Off are taken into consideration when calculating BoundingBox (extends) of the Document even though thay are not drawn. Inserts that belong to off layers still show their entities depending their visibility. Default value true (On). Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdLayer.Lock
member.summary: Get/Set a boolean value representing if the layer is frozen or not.
member.remarks: Objects that are in a locked layer are drawn but cannot be selected or modified. Default value false. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdLayer.LineWeight
member.summary: Get/Set the line weight of the layer.
member.remarks: Default value LW_DOCUMENTDEFAULT. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdLeader.ShouldBeTransformed(VectorDraw.Professional.vdCollections.vdSelection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method is used in order to determine what should happen when a transformBy occurs in a collection.
member.param: The selection of entities that is going to be transformed.
A boolean value representing if the object should disconnect from it's reference , referenceobj = null
member.returns: True if the transform should occur or false if not.
member.remarks: This method is used for example in the iteration of the CmdScale, when the user selects entities to scale then this method will return false if the reference object is also chosen in the selection so the Dimension is not transformed because it will apply the changes when the reference object is scaled.

member.summary: A Color control to give easy access to the color of the entities.
member.remarks: vdColorComboBox is a combobox like control to give you easy access to the Colors.
If none entity is selected then the activeColor is shown and you can easily select the activeColor.
If entities are selected to the Document then the Color of the entities is shown where you can easily change it.

member.name: T:VectorDraw.Render.BoundaryPoly
member.summary: Internally used only for Polylines Boundary detection.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Render.BoundaryPoly.getBoundaryPoly(VectorDraw.Geometry.gPoint,VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdDocument,VectorDraw.Professional.vdCollections.vdEntities,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Search the passed entities to find a closed perigram around the selected point.
member.param: The origin point in WCS which must be inside the desired closed path.
The vdDocument object where the action takes place.
A collection of entities that will be used to define the boundary.
A double representing the equality to be used in calculations(if this is equal to 0.0 the default = PixelSize * 1.4d is used).
A boolean value that represents if hatched filled entities will be exluded from input entities.
A key value used to cancel the method.
member.returns: A polyline that represents the closed perigram or null if a closed perigram was not found.
member.remarks: The return polyline has the active document default properties and it is not added in the active layout entities collection.
The end points of seaching curves are compared with a default equality equal to (active render pixel size) * 1.4 if passed the parameter is 0.0.
Only the 2d curves with extrution vector 0,0,1 and in tha same elevation as the z of origin are taken into consideration.
Only arcs , 2dpolylines , lines , circles, rectangles and ellipses, which are not filled are taken into consideration.
Ellipses and polylines with spline flag are exploded into small segments depent on curveresolution.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Render.BoundaryPoly.getBoundaryPoly(VectorDraw.Geometry.gPoint,VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdDocument,VectorDraw.Professional.vdCollections.vdEntities,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Windows.Forms.Keys,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Search the passed entities to find a closed perigram around the selected point.
member.param: The origin point in WCS which must be inside the desired closed path.
The vdDocument object where the action takes place.
A collection of entities that will be used to define the boundary.
A double representing the equality to be used in calculations(if this is equal to 0.0 the default = PixelSize * 1.4d is used).
A boolean value that represents if hatched filled entities will be exluded from input entities.
A key value used to cancel the method.
Set it to true in order to include entities in any elevation.
member.returns: A polyline that represents the closed perigram or null if a closed perigram was not found.
member.remarks: The return polyline has the active document default properties and it is not added in the active layout entities collection.
The end points of seaching curves are compared with a default equality equal to (active render pixel size) * 1.4 if passed the parameter is 0.0.
Only the 2d curves with extrution vector 0,0,1 and in tha same elevation as the z of origin are taken into consideration.
Only arcs , 2dpolylines , lines , circles, rectangles and ellipses, which are not filled are taken into consideration.
Ellipses and polylines with spline flag are exploded into small segments depent on curveresolution.

member.summary: Fills the passed args with all the table references of this object (vdLayer, vdBlock, vdDimstyle, vdLineType, vdTextstyle, vdImageDef, vdHatchPattern etc).
member.param: A object where the table references of this object will be added to.
member.remarks: Called by the , , method, or before deleting a table object. User custom objects that derived from vdFigure must implement this method and add the table references objects (vdLayer, vdBlock, vdDimstyle, vdLineType, vdTextstyle, vdImageDef, vdHatchPattern etc) to the passed argument

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdImageDef.ApplyEffects(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This method changes this vdImageDef's Bitmap by applying the passed effects controlled from the parameters. Note that after this call the Image will be Binded to the Document.
member.param: A boolean value representing if a gray effect will be applied. Pass true in order to apply the Grayscale effect.
A boolean value representing if a sepia effect will be applied. Pass true in order to apply the sepia effect.A standard value of 20 is used for this effect.
A boolean value representing is the colors of the Bitmap will be inverted. Pass true in order to Invert the colors.
An Integer value representing the Brightness to be applied to the Bitmap. Values should be from -255 to 255. Pass 0 to not apply any Brightness to the Bitmap.
An Integer value representing the Contrast to be applied to the Bitmap.Values should be from -100 to 100. Pass 0 to not apply any Contrast to the Bitmap.
An Integer value representing the Red alteration of the Bitmap. Values should be from -255 to 255. Pass 0 to not apply any red effect to the Bitmap.
An Integer value representing the Green alteration of the Bitmap. Values should be from -255 to 255. Pass 0 to not apply any Green effect to the Bitmap.
An Integer value representing the Blue alteration of the Bitmap. Values should be from -255 to 255. Pass 0 to not apply any Blue effect to the Bitmap.
A double value that represents the Red Gamma effect to be applied. Valid values are from 0.2 to 5.0. Pass 1.0 to not apply any Red Gamma effect to the Bitmap.
A double value that represents the Green Gamma effect to be applied. Valid values are from 0.2 to 5.0. Pass 1.0 to not apply any Green Gamma effect to the Bitmap.
A double value that represents the Blue Gamma effect to be applied. Valid values are from 0.2 to 5.0. Pass 1.0 to not apply any Blue Gamma effect to the Bitmap.
member.remarks: Note that after this call the Image will be Binded to the Document.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdImageDef.ApplyRotationFlip(VectorDraw.Render.vdRotateFlipTypeEnum)
member.summary: This method changes this vdImageDef's Bitmap by applying the passed RotateFlipType Rotation and Flip.Note that after this call the Image will be Binded to the Document.
member.param: A type to apply to this vdImageDef's Bitmap.
member.remarks: Note that after this call the Image will be Binded to the Document.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdPrint.ExportToLines
member.summary: Exports the printable view area into a vdDocument object that contains single lines for all drawing objects.
member.returns: A new a vdDocument object that contains single lines for all drawing objects.
member.remarks: Viewports of layouts are not exported. 3d views are exported as rendering mode. Exported lines are cliped inside area. Exported lines are tranformed relative to printer paper in milimiters with origin the UperLeft corner. All lines are added in the Model layout of the return document object and belongs to default Layer "0" with forground color. Expoting lines of a printer view into a vdcl file can be also done by seting the to an existing file with .vdcl extension.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdPrint.PrintOutPage
member.summary: Prints the selected vdLayout object to the selected printer device as a single page in a multi page printing operation.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdPrint.PrintOut
member.summary: Prints the selected vdLayout object to the selected printer device.
member.returns: True if successfully printed.
member.remarks: PerspectiveMode scenes are always printed with Layout view area fit to printer paper. When exporting into an EMF file (PrinterName property is a file with full path which ends with .emf extension) then the EMF resolution gets the closest matching resolution of the default printer's resolutions with property.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdPrint.paperSize
member.summary: Get/Set a Rectangle object which represents the paper size in portrait orientation. WARNING! In case of raster type files you should keep in mind that the maximum size of bitmap advised is 1GB. This is a size of 16384 X 16384 pixels multiplied by 4 (all pixels consist of 4 bytes). Papersize width and height are calculated by the formula width(or height) / 100 * resolution. Resolution is defined as pixels per inches.
member.remarks: This value is in hundrends of an inch and default value is (0, 0, 827, 1169). Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdPrint.margins
member.summary: Get/Set the MARGINS of the vdPrint object in hundrends of inches.
member.remarks: MARGINS are in hundrends of inches and default values are :(0,0,0,0) Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdPrint.Hardmargins
member.summary: Get the hard paper margins of the selected printer in hundrends of inches in current orientation.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdPrint.PrintableAreaMM
member.summary: Get the printable area without hard margins in hundrends of millimeters in current orientation.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdPrint.HardmarginsMM
member.summary: Get the hard margins of selected printer in hundrends of millimeters in current orientation.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdPrint.PrintScale
member.summary: Get/Set the PrinterScale of the vdPrint object.
member.remarks: Default value is 1.0/1.0 . If PerspectiveMode of reference is and RenderMode is 3d then always returns a Scale that Fit the PrintWindow to printer paper Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdPrint.PrintWindow
member.summary: Get/Set a Box that represents the drawing rectangle to be printed out.The Box is in drawing units in Current View Coordinate System.
member.remarks: By default returns the current display limits of the reference layout. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdPrint.Copies
member.summary: Get/Set the number of copies to be printed out.
member.remarks: Default value is 1. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdPrint.PrinterHInch2DUScale
member.summary: convert printer hinches to drawing units depend of printer scale

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdPrint.IgnoreGradientBG
member.summary: Enable / Disable the printing and the print preview of the background gradient color.
member.remarks: Default value is false. This applies ONLY for Model Space and Layouts and not for Vieports.

member.summary: Adds the parameters to the resolve list of the collection.
member.param: The object with the property to set(for example a vdDimension object).
A string representing the property name of the object(for example "Style")
A string representing the table name.(for example "mystyle1").
member.remarks: The resolve list of the collections is used to set to an object a property that is equal to an item of the list which may not be added yet to the collection. This is usually used when opening a format and you want to add a layer to a vdFigure and it is not certain that the layer is already added to the document.Use resolve list at the end of an open procedure of a format to resolve these properties.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdInsert.FadeEffect
member.summary: Get/Set the color Fading effect percentage close to the background color of output rendering.
member.remarks: Valid range between 0 and 90.Value is limited to 90 percent to avoid of hidden the entity. Default value is 0 for no fading. If the value is 0 and the figure is inside a vdBlock and the insert (vdInsert object) that reference this block has FadeEffect bigger than 0 then the figure is faded as the vdInsert. In other case (the figure has FadeEffect greater than 0 then the vdInsert's FadeEffect is ignored for this object. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdInsert.AlignToView
member.summary: A boolean value that defines if the plane of the object is relative to the current view.
member.remarks: Default value is False. Please note that when AlignToView is true the extrusion vector of the object is relative to Current view coordinative system and not to World as the default behaviour is. Also the Rotation property when AlignToView is true is relative and counterclockwise from axis X of current view coordinative system. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdInsert.AlignToViewSize
member.summary: Get/Set the height of the object in output Device millimeters for positive or hundreds of millimeters for negative.
member.remarks: If value is not 0 then the height of the object will be the same independently of current zoom. If value = 0 height is relative to Drawing Units. Negative values are in hundreds of millimeters of output device (screen/printer etc). For example, in order the object to have 1.5 millimeters height you must set it to -150 (means 150/100 millimeters). Default value = 0. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdInsert.ClipBoundary
member.summary: A boundary curve that will clip the vdInsert object and only the inside of the curve will be drawn.
member.remarks: Note that only top level clips supported. This means that if there is a vdInsert inside a vdInsert which contains a clipboundary object, it won't work. Only the clipboundary of the top vdInsert will work as expected. Also, vdInsert clipping does not work for OpenGL rendering, PDF and SVG export.

member.summary: Gets the matrix which is used to transform vectors or points from the object's object coordinate system (OCS) to the World Coordinate System (WCS).

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdInsert.Draw3DFlag
member.summary: Get/Set a property value used when drawing an object in 3d.
member.remarks: vdInsert objects that reference an ExternalReference Block are always ExcludeFromList. Set it to in order not to include the object in rendering 3d display lists, when the vdDocument.GlobalRenderProperties.CustomRenderTypeName = "VectorDraw.Render.opengllist#VectorDraw.Professional.dll" Default value is and the object is included in rendering 3d display lists. member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdTextstyle.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This instance precedes obj in the sort order. Zero This instance occurs in the same position in the sort order as obj. Greater than zero This instanceG follows obj in the sort order.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdPrimaries.vdTextstyle.FontFile
member.summary: Get/Set the font file of the textstyle.
member.remarks:
Default value :"Arial". Raizes the event. Raizes the event.
The in wire2D mode is enabled ONLY when value is true and the FontFile has the fullpath and filename of the TTF font, like : "C:\MyApp\Fonts\arialbd.ttf". If the FontFile property has a value like "Arial Bold" and not "..path..\arialbd.ttf" then DrawOutline is ignored.

member.returns: A collection of closed solid fill vdPolyline objects each one contains all triangles belongs to the same plane.

member.param: Equality used to compare properties.
Set it to in order to get information about the progress percentage
member.remarks: This method uses a combination of ToPolylines and triangulation of gPoints in order to make this polyface with less faces. You can use this method after a cut/slice to make the polyface a little better.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPolyface.Generate3dPathSection(VectorDraw.Geometry.gPoints,VectorDraw.Generics.vdArray{VectorDraw.Geometry.gPoints},VectorDraw.Geometry.gPoint,System.Double,System.Double,VectorDraw.Geometry.Vector,VectorDraw.Geometry.Vector,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Modify a vdPolyface object following a given path and drawing a given section
member.param: Array of one or more closed 2d sections
A 2d point relative to sections array that defines the origin of sections. This point will run over the path line
An array of points in real world Coordinate System
Angle in radians that sections will be rotated around base point before they mapped on the path line.
The ending scale of the section object(the section object will start following the path with scale=1.0 and will end with scale=SectionScale).Set it to 1 for no scale.
The extrution vector of the plane of the start section.If it is null the vector of the start segment is used.
The extrution vector of the plane of the end section.If it is null the vector of the end segment is used.
Defines if the start and end caps of the path will be filled.
True in order to clear all vertecies that are used twice from the object's vertexlist at the end of procedure.
member.returns: True if successed.

example.para: Create a rectangle Frame of 10 x 10 size in drawing units with a rectangle section 1 x 1 size.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPolyface.Generate3dPathSection(VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdCurve,VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdCurve,VectorDraw.Geometry.gPoint,System.Int32,System.Double,VectorDraw.Geometry.Vector,VectorDraw.Geometry.Vector)
member.summary: Modify a vdPolyface object following a given path and drawing a given section
member.param: A vdCurve object where the polyface will be drawn.
A vdCurve object
A point in relation to the section (in WCS) indicating the point that will follow the path and draw the section object.
This parameter infects the smoothness of the polyface.
The ending scale of the section object(the section object will start following the path with scale=1.0 and will end with scale=SectionScale).Default value=1.
The extrution vector of the plane of the start section.If it is null the vector of the start segment is used.
The extrution vector of the plane of the end section.If it is null the vector of the end segment is used.
member.returns: True if successed.
member.remarks: If CurveResolution equals to 0 the polyface uses the default CurveResolution of the control, else this value represents the number of the segments of the path( the bigger this value is , the smoother the polyface will be). The section must be in WCS with extrution 0,0,1 if section is a polyline then the points of pline must be in the same plane(they must have z value == 0.0) path,section can be circle arc polyline ellipse rectangle line if path is a polyline then the points of pline must be in the same plane

example.para: Create a rectangle Frame of 1.2 x 2.1 size in drawing units with a rectangle section 0.1 x 0.05 size.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPolyface.InternalVolume(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double@,System.Boolean,VectorDraw.Geometry.gPoint@)
member.summary: Calculates an Approximation of the Volume of the polyface object.Note that the vdPolyface must be closed in order to calculate the volume or the result will not be accurate.
member.param: A double value to be used as precision.
1 for axis x , 2 for axis y , 3 for axis z , other so the minimum size will be chosen.
A double value where the volume is going to be returned.
A boolean value representing if the centerofvolume is going to be calculated.
A gPoint object where it is going to be calculated and returned the center of volume of the object.
member.returns: True if the process ended succesfully or false if the calculation failed.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPolyface.Volume(System.Double,System.Double@,VectorDraw.Geometry.gPoint@)
member.summary: Calculates an Approximation of the Volume of the polyface object.Note that the vdPolyface must be closed in order to calculate the volume or the result will not be accurate.
member.param: A double value to be used as precision.If precision 0.0 is passed then a default 100 slices precision is being used.
A double value where the volume is going to be returned.
A gPoint object where it is going to be calculated and returned the center of volume of the object.
member.returns: True if the process ended succesfully or false if the calculation failed.
member.remarks: The method calculates the smallest size of the bounding box of the object and performs perpedicular slices calculating the small volumes that are produced. The total Volume of the object is the sum of these volumes. The precision is the step of the slices. If 0.0 precision is passed then 100 slices are performed.

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPolyface.Volume(System.Double,System.Double@)
member.summary: Calculates an Approximation of the Volume of the polyface object.Note that the vdPolyface must be closed in order to calculate the volume or the result will not be accurate.
member.param: A double value to be used as precision.If precision 0.0 is passed then a default 100 slices precision is being used.
A double value where the volume is going to be returned.
member.returns: True if the process ended succesfully or false if the calculation failed.
member.remarks: The method calculates the smallest size of the bounding box of the object and performs perpedicular slices calculating the small volumes that are produced. The total Volume of the object is the sum of these volumes. The precision is the step of the slices. If 0.0 precision is passed then 100 slices are performed.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPolyface.SmoothAngle
member.summary: Get/Set the angle in degrees between 0 and 90 used to calculate normals for each vertex in each face when rendering a polyface object. Defines the maximun angle which is compared with the angles between the planes of neighboring faces in order to filter out the normals of the planes that will added in the average calculation.
member.remarks: Set it to -1 in order the normals to be smoothing according to the property. Set it to 0 in order the normals not to be smoothing. Set it to 90 in order the normal of each vertex to be calculated as the average value with all the neighboring faces normals. Default value is -1.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPolyface.GradientColors

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPolyface.FaceList
member.summary: A collection of integers indicating for each face four edges that rest on each of the face's 4 points. Also the color the face has (the fifth value of every face, if -1 the object's color is used). If any of the four edge values is negative, this edge is not drawn (the face is drawn normally).
member.remarks: If a vdPolyface object has 4 faces then the facelist count should be 20. Default value a new created empty collection of integers. Raizes the event. Raizes the event.

member.name: P:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.vdPolyface.CombineCuttedEdgesVisibility
member.summary: Get/Set a boolean value that represents the visibility of the cutted edges when combining (boolean operations) vdPolyfaces.
member.remarks: Default value is true so the edges are visible. Note that this is a static property internally so if changed it is applied to all boolean operations of the control.

member.name: T:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.BooleanOperation
member.summary: Used in Boolean operationd between polyfaces.

member.name: F:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.BooleanOperation.Union
member.summary: Determines the union of the two polyfaces. The result is an object that contains both polyfaces.

member.name: F:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.BooleanOperation.Substraction
member.summary: Determines the subscractions of polyface A from polyface B. The result is the polyface A not having the polyface B inside it.

member.name: F:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.BooleanOperation.Intersection
member.summary: Determines the intersection of the two polyfaces.The result is the common triangles of the two polyfaces.

member.name: F:VectorDraw.Professional.vdFigures.BooleanOperation.ReverseSubsctraction
member.summary: Determines the reverse subsctraction of the two polyfaces. The result is the opposite of the Subscraction operation.

The size of the rectangle in pixels.
The mouse location in current view coordinate system.
The reference point of the action in current view coordinate system.This value can be null.

member.remarks: Entities in lock layers are not returned if does not contain the value of .

The y coordinate of the upper left origin of the graphics device in pixels.
Width of rendering device in pixels
Height of rendering device in pixels

The maximun size in pixels of width and height can be used to render a sub rectangle on the selected graphics device. Useful to be used when destWidthPix and destHeightPix are too large. This will split the rendering in number of rows and columns recrtangles depend of the destWidthPix , destHeightPix and SplitSize. For example if destWidthPix = 8000 and destHeight = 8000 and SplitSize = 1000 it will split the render in 8x8 rendering images Set it to 0 for rendering at once in one single rectangle.
member.remarks: VectorDraw automatically centers and fits the rendering area to the specified image size. You can control the output quality using the following properties with gr passed parameter

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdDocument.StartThread(System.String)
member.summary: Mast be called at the start of a method that supports multi-thread
member.remarks: WARNING!!!! There is problem with multi-thread rendering of vfFigure.Draw and with fields (mDrawCount ,mListCount , mList inside PrepareBeforeDraw, AfterDraw, ListStart,ListEnd)
Except if we use lock{} in vdFigure.Draw
Generally vdFigures are calculate some properties inside Draw(like list - samplePoints penstyle etc, so they can not be called multi times and they must be inside lock.
Also the same problem is for vdFigure.BoundingBox get{} it must also be inside lock{}
Create new object references for properties that shared.
For multi-thread rendering the vdRender object must be new and not one of Layout default render properties.
Must be careful with reference values that used duting multi-thread call so not to be share.If we can not create new reference for these values we must use them inside the lock{}

member.name: M:VectorDraw.Professional.vdObjects.vdDocument.GetVisibleAreas(VectorDraw.Professional.vdCollections.vdEntities,VectorDraw.Professional.vdCollections.vdSelection,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a object that is used to get the visible areas of passed entities at any view direction
member.param: A collection of objects that make up the entire drawing.
A collection of vdFigures for which the visible area will be calculated in connection with the entire drawing.If it is null the visible area of passed entities will be calculated.
Defines the size of small square in Drawing units that each surface is divided. Smaller values gets more time to calculate.
The size of the temporary rendering context used to calculate the visible areas.Higher values require more time and offer better precision.Valid values between 640 , 2048.
member.returns: An array of object type that contains information about the area of each passed vdFigure object in each view.
